exm.mng: Vermilion Bird (the seven mansions of the south sky)
(bird species of China) Eurasian skylark (Alauda arvensis)
lit. crow and peacock make no sound, absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard, absolute silence
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
(bird species of China) brambling (Fringilla montifringilla), (fig.) small fry
The sparrow may be small but all its vital organs are there (idiom)., small but complete in every detail
exm.pyn: má què suī xiǎo , wǔ zàng jù quán

exm.mng: The mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
exm.pyn: táng láng bǔ chán , huáng què zài hòu

exm.mng: lit. can the sparrow and swallow know the will of the great swan? (idiom), fig. how can we small fry predict the ambitions of the great?
exm.pyn: yàn què ān zhī hóng hú zhī zhì
